_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Targa Pipeline Mid-Continent Holdings LLC

Chaney Dell Gas Plant (Facility ID: 100000135249)



ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES

Targa Pipeline Mid-Continent Holdings LLC (Targa) owns and operates a natural gas processing plant called Chaney Dell Gas Plant in Major County, Oklahoma. The facility is designed to process natural gas and recover liquid product from natural gas by physical separation. Petroleum condensates are transported onward to another facility for processing. 



The Chaney Dell Gas Plant has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by our efforts in accident prevention, such as training personnel, quality assurance, and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of our process.  Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However if a release does occur, facility trained personnel will evaluate the situation, take actions within the capabilities of the plant, and notify the necessary outside agencies.



DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The Chaney Dell Gas Plant is located approximately 4 miles north of Ringwood, Oklahoma, on Highway 58 and operates the process to produce the following petroleum products:



1. Natural Gas Liquid Product (Y-Grade)

2. Residue Gas



OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS (OCA) RESULTS



Targa treats the entire facility as one process.  Several vessels at the gas plant were evaluated for offsite consequence analyses.  There is one worst-case scenario (WCS) associated with a release of flammable substances at the Chaney Dell Gas Plant.  The scenario involves a vapor cloud explosion involving 360,349 pounds (75,700 gallons) of a flammable mixture contained in one natural gas liquid storage tank. The entire inventory is assumed to release and ignite, resulting in a vapor cloud explosion and impacting an

area with a 0.5 mile radius. The rest of the vessels that were evaluated have a radius smaller than and located within the WCS radius.   



The facility is not located within a populated area; therefore, the WCS would not impact an off site public receptor and is considered a Program 1 process.  A consideration of the 0.5 miles radius has been incorporated into our notification and emergency response planning.



GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



The Chaney Dell Gas Plant is covered by the OSHA PSM Program to aid in accident release prevention. 



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The Chaney Dell Gas Plant has an excellent record of accident prevention since start-up.  There have been no accidental releases from the covered process that resulted in death, injury or significant property damage on site, or known off site death, injury, evacuation, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage during this period.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATION



The Chaney Dell Gas Plant is a Non-Responding Facility as per 48 CFR 68.90(b). The plant maintains a written emergency response plan, which is in place to help protect employees and public safety as well as the environment.  The plan identifies steps to be taken in case of an accidental release including: evacuation plans, accounting for personnel after an evacuation, and notification of Targa staff, local emergency response agencies, and the public. However, facility personnel are not trained to be first responders to large fires and should a release occur from one of the vessels, Targa would rely on the local fire department to respond.  



Employees receive training in the procedures to be followed when certain employees must remain to operate critical plant operations before they evacuate.  The Chaney Dell Gas Plant has around-the-clock communications capability with appropriate emergency response organizations (Fire Department, Police and Sheriff's Office).  This interface provides t

he means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident.



ORGANIZATIONAL CHART

The following provides a facility organizational chart with respect to RMP responsibilities.



NAME: Clint Duty

TITLE: Vice President, ES&H

REPORTS TO: Pat McDonie, President

RESPONSIBILITIES:  Oversight of corporate RMP implementation, environmental compliance, and regulatory compliance.



NAME: Arnie Krush

TITLE: Area Manager

REPORTS TO: Dwayne Burks, Vice President Operations

RESPONSIBILITIES:  Oversight of plant level RMP implementation, spill prevention, response record-keeping, training, and inspections. Primary response coordinator.



NAME: Ernie Hiland

TITLE: Supervisor, Plants

REPORTS TO: Arnie Krush, Area Manager

RESPONSIBILITIES:  Oversight of plant level RMP implementation, spill prevention, response record-keeping, training, and inspections. Primary response coordinator.



NAME/TITLE: Area Supervisors

REPORTS TO: Response Coordinators

RESPONSIBILITIES: Assist Coordinators with RMP implementation and report incidents



NAME/TITLE: Onsite Personnel

REPORTS TO: Area Supervisors and Response Coordinators

RESPONSIBILITIES: Good housekeeping, reporting maintenance issues & incidents



NAME/TITLE: Onsite Contractors

REPORTS TO: Response Coordinators

RESPONSIBILITIES: Good housekeeping, reporting maintenance issues & incidents 



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 



There are currently no planned changes to improve safety. Rather, the company believes that diligent compliance with our RMP Prevention Program forms the framework that allows for the continued improvement to the level of safety at the Chaney Dell Gas Plant. Some of the key components of the program that will help maintain and, where applicable, improve safety are:



The Management of Change provisions ensure that we consider the potential safety and health impacts of any change we make to chemicals, technology, equipment or procedures

.



The PHA provisions serve as a tool to ensure continual evaluation of potential hazards, thereby leading to continual improvements in our safety standards. 



The Mechanical Integrity provisions ensure that equipment and instrumentation are designed, constructed, installed and maintained to minimize the risk of hazardous release thereby serving as an integral part of our safety program.



Internal and third party compliance audits will ensure that we maintain and increase our level of safety protection.
